sub_topic: Finding the perimeter of a rectangle.
message_1: A rectangular garden has a length of 12 feet and a width of 8 feet. What is the perimeter of the garden?
message_2:
To find the perimeter of a rectangle, you can use the formula P = 2(L + W), where P is the perimeter, L is the length, and W is the width.

In this case, the length (L) is 12 feet and the width (W) is 8 feet. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

P = 2(12 + 8)
P = 2(20)
P = 40 feet

So, the perimeter of the garden is 40 feet.
